item.title: PI itemonnpc.java file
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Cres link=topic=458031.msg3352155#msg3352155 date=1285443409]
woohoo! i found how to do it ,
epic thx vain =D
[/quote]May I see how?
I cleaned on my UseItem class, so I don’t even have itemOnItem. :P[/quote]

that line you gave me provided the variables ; the line you had to use is simply the same as itemonitem / itemonobject , just had to change the variables =D

	public static void ItemonNpc(Client c, int itemId, int npcId, int slot) {
		if (itemId == 1215 || npcId == 1599)
			c.sendMessage("succes!");
		switch(itemId) {
		
		default:
			if(c.playerRights == 3)
				Misc.println("Player used Item id: "+itemId+" with Npc id: "+npcId+" With Slot : "+slot);
			break;
		}
		
	}

so in this case , when i use dragon dagger on duradel , i will get the message " succes!"

item.title: PI itemonnpc.java file
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

I am working on this Upgrading project at which when a player uses a certain item on a certain npc , the item will dissapear , along with some money , and give them a new item…
however , this is how my itemonnpc.java file looks like :


package server.model.players.packets;

import server.Server;
import server.model.items.UseItem;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;


public class ItemOnNpc implements PacketType {

	@Override
	public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
		int itemId = c.getInStream().readSignedWordA();
		int i = c.getInStream().readSignedWordA();
		int slot = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
		int npcId = Server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType;
		
		UseItem.ItemonNpc(c, itemId, npcId, slot);
	}
}

i don’t know WHAT to write or WHERE to write it…
i do think i can figure out the snippet itself but i do need help on the location to write it…

hope to get some help soon , thx

Read full topic
